Utils Module

The Utils class encompasses a collection of static utility functions designed to facilitate various tasks within the PITA Algorithm framework. These functions include, but are not limited to, parameter randomization and coordinate adjustments relative to defined boundaries.

Usage

The Utils class provides static methods that can be directly invoked.

Key Functionalities

  • Randomization Parameter Retrieval: Extracts randomization parameters from a configuration dictionary, supporting diverse simulation dynamics.

  • Coordinate Offset and Scaling: Adjusts object coordinates to ensure they fit within the designated area boundaries, crucial for accurate object placement.

class pita_algorithm.utils.general_utils.Utils[source]

Bases: object

Collection of utility functions.

static get_randomization_parameters(config_dict: dict, keys: list) → tuple[source]

Reads the randomization parameters in config_dict for the given keys.

Parameters:

  • config_dict (dict) – Contains information about world settings

  • keys (list) – List of keys to read from the config_dict

Returns:

Tuple containing the values for the given keys in the order they were passed

Return type:

tuple

static offset_coordinates_to_boundaries(position: tuple[float, float, float], boundary: tuple[tuple[float, float], tuple[float, float]], reference_boundaries: tuple[tuple[float, float], tuple[float, float]]) → tuple[float, float, float][source]

Converts the coordinates of a MujocoObject to match the boundaries of the Area.

Parameters:

  • position (tuple[float, float, float]) – The coordinates of the MujocoObject.

  • boundary (tuple[tuple[float, float], tuple[float, float]]) – The boundaries of the Area.

  • reference_boundaries (tuple[tuple[float, float], tuple[float, float]]) – The boundaries of the reference Area -> Environment Size.

Returns:

The converted coordinates.

Return type:

tuple[float, float, float]
